content:
===========
==>STEP NUM: 0
==>ACT: Init
==>OBSERVATION: "I'm in trouble," he says. "I had a few too many at The Shanty. I was looking for Red, but he wasn't around, and I started talking about ... here," he says, handing you a slim volume that you recognize as a shipwreck book written years ago by the Historical Society.

You smile. Every diver on the island has looked for those wrecks, without even an old boot to show for it. You open the door, hoping the drunken fool will leave. "I know what you're thinkin'," Hevlin scowls, "but look!" He points to the familiar map, and you see new locations marked for two of the wrecks.

"Keep it for me," he says. "Just for tonight. It'll be safe here with you. Don't let -- " He stops and broods for a moment. "I've got to go find Red!" And with that, Hevlin leaves.

You put the book in your dresser and think about following Hevlin. Then you hear a scuffle outside. You look through your window and see two men struggling. One falls to the ground in a heap. The other man bends down beside him, then turns as if startled and runs away. Another man then approaches the wounded figure. He kneels beside him for a long moment, then takes off after the other man.

It isn't long before the police arrive to tell you that Hevlin's been murdered. You don't mention the book, and hours later, as you lie awake in your bed, you wonder if the book could really be what it seems.

CUTTHROATS
Copyright (c) 1984 by Infocom, Inc. All rights reserved.
CUTTHROATS is a trademark of Infocom, Inc.
Release 23 / Serial number 840809

Your Room, on the bed
You're in your room in the Red Boar Inn. It's sparsely furnished, but comfortable enough. To the north is the door, and there's a closet without a door to the west.
On the floor is a note that must have been slipped under the door while you slept.
In a corner of the room is a lopsided wooden dresser.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 1
==>ACT: look out window
==>OBSERVATION: You see an abandoned field beyond the alley where the terrible events of last night transpired.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 2
==>ACT: wind watch
==>OBSERVATION: Okay. You've wound the watch.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 3
==>ACT: get out of bed
==>OBSERVATION: You get out of bed.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 4
==>ACT: read note
==>OBSERVATION: The note is hastily scrawled:

"If you're interested in a big deal, be at The Shanty at 8:30 this morning.
               -Johnny"

===========
==>STEP NUM: 5
==>ACT: open dresser
==>OBSERVATION: Opening the dresser reveals a Mariners' Trust passbook, a book of shipwrecks, and a room key, as well as your clothes.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 6
==>ACT: get passbook and room key
==>OBSERVATION: Mariners' Trust passbook: Taken.
room key: Taken.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 7
==>ACT: look in closet
==>OBSERVATION: The closet contains:
  A wet suit
  An air tank
  A diving mask
  A pair of flippers

===========
==>STEP NUM: 8
==>ACT: inventory
==>OBSERVATION: You are carrying:
  A room key
  A Mariners' Trust passbook
  A wrist watch (being worn)
You have $20 in your pocket.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 9
==>ACT: open door
==>OBSERVATION: The bedroom door is now open.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 10
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: Upstairs Hallway
You are at the top of the stairs in the Red Boar. Your room is to the south, and other rooms line the hall. The lighting in the hallway is dim and drab like the wallpaper and carpeting.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 11
==>ACT: close door
==>OBSERVATION: The bedroom door is now closed.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 12
==>ACT: lock door
==>OBSERVATION: (with the room key)
The bedroom door is now locked.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 13
==>ACT: wait
==>OBSERVATION: Time passes...
 Upstairs Hallway                                                                                                            Time:  8:13 am                     Upstairs Hallway                                                                                                            Time:  8:14 am                    You begin to feel hungry.
 Upstairs Hallway                                                                                                            Time:  8:15 am                     Upstairs Hallway                                                                                                            Time:  8:16 am                     Upstairs Hallway                                                                                                            Time:  8:17 am                     Upstairs Hallway                                                                                                            Time:  8:18 am                     Upstairs Hallway                                                                                                            Time:  8:19 am                     Upstairs Hallway                                                                                                            Time:  8:20 am                     Upstairs Hallway                                                                                                            Time:  8:21 am                     Upstairs Hallway                                                                                                            Time:  8:22 am

===========
==>STEP NUM: 14
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: Red Boar Inn
This is the lobby of the Red Boar Inn, a place with the charm of a two-dollar flophouse. The Wharf Road is outside, to the north, and a stairway leads up to the rooms to the south.
A desk clerk sits behind the counter.
The Weasel walks past you.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 15
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: Wharf Road
This is the end of the Wharf Road, an east/west, two-lane road that's the island's main street. Off to the east, small businesses line the south side of the street. A winding road starts to the southwest, heading toward the lighthouse. The Red Boar Inn is to the south.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 16
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: Wharf Road
You are on the Wharf Road, with the McGinty Salvage office to the south. The ocean lies to the north, its brine smell strong and refreshing.
Your throat starts to feel dry.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 17
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: Wharf Road
You are on the Wharf Road where the wharf starts up to the north. The former site of Outfitters International's warehouse fronts the south side of the road.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 18
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: Wharf Road
The east/west Wharf Road continues, with Outfitters International, a store which supplies ocean-going vessels, to the south.
To the west the Weasel comes into view from the south.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 19
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: Wharf Road
You're on the east end of Wharf Road. The Ocean Road starts here and parallels the island's east edge, heading to the southeast. The Shanty is to the south.
The Weasel is to the west, heading toward the east.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 20
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: The Shanty
This is The Shanty, a tavern which serves the locals. A wooden bar travels the length of the place, and behind it is a mirror so dirty, it offers no reflection. Round tables occupy the floor. The smell of cooking food permeates the place.
A bartender behind the bar polishes glasses with a worn towel.
A parrot with an eyepatch hobbles up and down the bar.
A man wearing an eyepatch, black turtleneck, and jeans is standing about. He is known as Pete the Rat.
Johnny Red is here. Red hair sprouts from his head and from beneath his flannel shirt.
"Sit down and we'll talk," Johnny Red says.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 21
==>ACT: sit
==>OBSERVATION: (on the chair)
You are now on the chair.
Johnny says, "When the Weasel shows, I'll tell ya what we got."

===========
==>STEP NUM: 22
==>ACT: order food
==>OBSERVATION: You have bought a meal for $5.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 23
==>ACT: order drink
==>OBSERVATION: You have bought a drink for $2.
The Weasel approaches, glancing around furtively.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 24
==>ACT: eat food
==>OBSERVATION: Not bad! It really hit the spot.
At Pete's request, the Weasel joins you. Johnny then whispers that he's come across some sunken treasure.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 25
==>ACT: drink drink
==>OBSERVATION: It burns your throat on the way down.
 The Shanty                                                                                                            Time:  8:34 am                     The Shanty                                                                                                            Time:  8:35 am                    Johnny explains that they need more money to get started. They chose you because they know you've salted some money away and you're a great diver. He asks if you're interested in the deal.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 26
==>ACT: yes
==>OBSERVATION: Johnny looks around and says, "This is no place to continue. If McGinty finds out about this, we're sunk. We better meet at the lighthouse at 9:30. Glad you're aboard."

===========
==>STEP NUM: 27
==>ACT: get out of chair
==>OBSERVATION: You are on your feet again.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 28
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: Wharf Road

===========
==>STEP NUM: 29
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Wharf Road

===========
==>STEP NUM: 30
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Wharf Road

===========
==>STEP NUM: 31
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: Vacant Lot
You are standing on the former site of the Outfitters International warehouse, which burned down a few months back. To the north is the Wharf Road and an alley is to the south.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 32
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: Back Alley
You are in an east/west alley. To the north is a vacant lot, and an overgrown field lies to the south.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 33
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Back Alley
You are in a narrow alley. To the north is the back door of McGinty Salvage, as well as a small window. An overgrown field lies to the south.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 34
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Back Alley
You're at the west end of an east/west alley. The back entrance to the Red Boar Inn is to the north, and an overgrown field is to the south.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 35
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: Back Alley

===========
==>STEP NUM: 36
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: Back Alley

===========
==>STEP NUM: 37
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: Back Alley
You are in an alley behind Outfitters International. An abandoned field lies to the south.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 38
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: Back Alley
You're at the east end of an east/west alley. The back door of The Shanty is to the north, and an overgrown field is to the south. Narrow paths to the northeast and southeast lead to the Ocean Road.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 39
==>ACT: northeast
==>OBSERVATION: Ocean Road
You are at the north end of the Ocean Road, a narrow north/south road on the east edge of the island. The Wharf Road starts to the northwest, and a back alley starts off to the southwest.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 40
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: Ocean Road
You are halfway along the Ocean Road, with the start of an alley off to the northwest. An empty field lies to your west, and the dangerous ocean shore lies off to your east.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 41
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: Ocean Road
This is the south end of the Ocean Road. To the southeast is a small path leading up to about 100 feet above sea level. The Ocean Road heads north, and the Shore Road starts to the southwest.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 42
==>ACT: southwest
==>OBSERVATION: Shore Road
This is the east end of the Shore Road, an east/west road with a ferry landing at its west end. The Mariners' Trust, the island's only bank, is off to the north. The Ocean Road starts up to the northeast.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 43
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Shore Road
You are at the west end of the east/west Shore Road, with the ferry landing to the west. To the north is an impenetrable field, while the south is bordered by the ocean. You can see the mainland in the distance.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 44
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Ferry Landing
The ferry to the mainland arrives here every two hours during the day. People are milling about. The Shore Road starts off to the east.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 45
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: Shore Road

===========
==>STEP NUM: 46
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: Shore Road

===========
==>STEP NUM: 47
==>ACT: wait
==>OBSERVATION: Time passes...
 Shore Road                                                                                                            Time:  8:58 am                     Shore Road                                                                                                            Time:  8:59 am                     Shore Road                                                                                                            Time:  9:00 am                     Shore Road                                                                                                            Time:  9:01 am                     Shore Road                                                                                                            Time:  9:02 am                     Shore Road                                                                                                            Time:  9:03 am                     Shore Road                                                                                                            Time:  9:04 am                     Shore Road                                                                                                            Time:  9:05 am                     Shore Road                                                                                                            Time:  9:06 am                     Shore Road                                                                                                            Time:  9:07 am

===========
==>STEP NUM: 48
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: Mariners' Trust
You are in Mariners' Trust, the Island's bank. In it are a table and a teller's window. You can see the safe beyond, and it looks pretty empty.
A teller sits behind the window.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 49
==>ACT: withdraw $603
==>OBSERVATION: The teller takes your passbook, enters the withdrawal, hands you the money and your passbook, and says "Have a good day."

===========
==>STEP NUM: 50
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: Shore Road

===========
==>STEP NUM: 51
==>ACT: northeast
==>OBSERVATION: Ocean Road

===========
==>STEP NUM: 52
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: Ocean Road

===========
==>STEP NUM: 53
==>ACT: northwest
==>OBSERVATION: Back Alley

===========
==>STEP NUM: 54
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Back Alley

===========
==>STEP NUM: 55
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Back Alley

===========
==>STEP NUM: 56
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Back Alley

===========
==>STEP NUM: 57
==>ACT: open window
==>OBSERVATION: You open it enough to fit through it.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 58
==>ACT: look through window
==>OBSERVATION: You see McGinty's office.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 59
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Back Alley

===========
==>STEP NUM: 60
==>ACT: drop passbook
==>OBSERVATION: Dropped.

===========
==>STEP NUM: 61
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: Back Alley

===========
==>STEP NUM: 62
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: Back Alley

===========
